intro: Cryptantha propria, commonly known as the narrowleaf cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain the seeds. Cryptantha propria is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along stream banks.
